questions.text: A 40-year-old male suffering from kala azar was found to have a significant rise in urea and creatinine after 10 days of treatment with amphotericin B. What is the mechanism behind this rise?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Pre renal Pre renal: Pre-renal azotemia is the most common form of acute kidney injury It is the designation for rice in serum creatinine and bun concentration due to inadequate renal plasma flow and intra-glomerular hydrostatic pressure to support normal glomerular filtration The most common clinical conditions associated with pre-renal azotemia are hypovolemia , medications that interfere with renal autoregulatory responses like amphotericin b This can cause renal vasoconstriction from an increase in tubuloglomerular feedback as well as direct blood toxicity mediated by reactive oxygen species This is an example of pre-renal acute kidney injury

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true about acute kidney injury?

options.label: A
options.text: Impairment of kidney filtration and excretory function over days to weeks

options.label: B
options.text: AKI is a designation for a heterogeneous group of conditions that share common diagnostic features

options.label: C
options.text: AKI is a clinical diagnosis and not a structural one

options.label: D
options.text: AKI is always associated with injury to the kidney parenchyma

questions.correct_answer: D. AKI is always associated with injury to the kidney parenchyma
questions.explanation:
Solution:

AKI is always associated with injury to the kidney parenchyma A patient may have AKI with or without injury to the kidney parenchyma. It can be pre-renal, renal, and post-renal

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A: Acute kidney injury (AKI) is defined by the impairment of kidney filtration and excretory function over days to weeks, resulting in the retention of nitrogenous and other waste products normally cleared by the kidneys. Option: B: AKI is not a single disease but, rather, a designation for a heterogeneous group of conditions that share common diagnostic features: specifically, an increase in serum creatinine (SCr) concentration often associated with a reduction in urine volume. Option: C: It is important to recognize that AKI is a clinical diagnosis and not a structural one.

questions.text: Acute kidney injury (AKI) is when your kidneys suddenly stop working properly. It can range from minor loss of kidney function to complete kidney failure. AKI normally happens as a complication of another serious illness. It's not the result of a physical blow to the kidneys, as the name might suggest. Which of the following is the intrinsic cause of AKI?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Malignant hypertension

questions.text: Prerenal azotemia is the most common form of kidney failure in hospitalized people. Any condition that reduces blood flow to the kidney may cause it, including: Burns. Conditions that allow fluid to escape from the bloodstream. Long-term vomiting, diarrhea, or bleeding. All of the following are often seen in prerenal azotemia EXCEPT?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Increased jugular venous pressure Physical signs of orthostatic hypotension, tachycardia, reduced jugular venous pressure, decreased skin turgor , and dry mucous membranes are often present in prerenal azotemia.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A, C & D: Often seen in prerenal azotemia.

questions.text: AKI ranges from minor loss of kidney function to complete kidney failure. AKI normally happens as a complication of another serious illness. It's not the result of a physical blow to the kidneys, as the name might suggest. Which of the following is NOT true about defining acute kidney injury?

options.label: A
options.text: An elevation in the SCr concentration from baseline of at least 0.3 mg/dL within 48 h

options.label: B
options.text: An elevation in the SCr concentration at least 50% higher than baseline within 1 week

options.label: C
options.text: Reduction in urine output to <1.0 mL/kg per h within 1 week

options.label: D
options.text: Reduction in urine output to <0.5 mL/kg per h for longer than 6 h

questions.correct_answer: C. Reduction in urine output to <1.0 mL/kg per h within 1 week
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Reduction in urine output to <1.0 mL/kg per h within 1 week AKI is currently defined by a rise from baseline of at least 0.3 mg/dL within 48 h or at least 50% higher than baseline within 1 week, or a reduction in urine output to <0.5 mL/kg per h for longer than 6 h.

Highyeild:

Staging of Acute Kidney Injury Severity STAGE SERUM CREATININE URINE OUTPUT 1 1.5-1.9 times baseline OR ≥0.3 mg/dL (≥26.5 μmol/L) increase <0.5 mL/kg per h for 6-12 h 2 2.0-2.9 times baseline <0.5 mL/kg per h for ≥12 h 3 3.0 times baseline OR increase in serum creatinine to ≥4.0 mg/dL (≥353.6 µmol/L) OR initiation of renal replacement therapy OR, in patients <18 years of age, decrease in eGFR to <35 mL/min per 1.73 m² <0.3 mL/kg per h for ≥24 h OR Anuria for ≥12 h

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A, B, D: True

Extraedge:

The KDIGO guidelines define AKI as follows: Increase in serum creatinine by ≥0.3 mg/dL (≥26.5 micromol/L) within 48 hours, or Increase in serum creatinine to ≥1.5 times baseline , which is known or presumed to have occurred within the prior seven days, or Urine volume <0.5 mL/kg/hour for six hours AKI severity is staged based on the magnitude of the rise in SCr and the severity and duration of oliguria

questions.text: Which of the following is an industrial agent that has caused outbreaks of severe AKI around the world due to adulteration of pharmaceutical preparations?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Diethylene glycol Diethylene glycol is an industrial agent that has caused outbreaks of severe AKI around the world due to adulteration of pharmaceutical preparations. The metabolite 2-hydroxy ethoxy acetic acid (HEAA) is thought to be responsible for tubular injury.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A Ethylene glycol, present in automobile antifreeze , is metabolized to oxalic acid, glycolaldehyde, and glyoxylate, which may cause AKI through direct tubular injury and tubular obstruction. Option: C Melamine contamination of foodstuffs has led to nephrolithiasis and AKI , either through an intratubular obstruction or possibly direct tubular toxicity. Option: D Aristolochic acid was found to be the cause of ‘Chinese herb nephropathy’ and ‘Balkan nephropathy’ due to contamination of medicinal herbs or farming.

questions.text: Post-renal AKI occurs after acute obstruction of the urinary flow, which increases intra-tubular pressure and thus decreases GFR. In addition, acute urinary tract obstruction can lead to impaired renal blood flow and inflammatory processes that also contribute to diminished GFR. All of the following about post-renal AKI are TRUE EXCEPT?

options.label: A
options.text: Occurs when the normally unidirectional flow of urine is acutely blocked either partially or totally

options.label: B
options.text: Normal urinary flow rate rules out the presence of partial obstruction

options.label: C
options.text: Obstruction must affect both kidneys in order to observe large increases in SCr

options.label: D
options.text: Unilateral obstruction may cause AKI in the setting of significant underlying CKD

questions.correct_answer: B. Normal urinary flow rate rules out the presence of partial obstruction
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Normal urinary flow rate rules out the presence of partial obstruction A normal urinary flow rate does not rule out the presence of partial obstruction , because the GFR is normally two orders of magnitude higher than the urinary flow rate and hence preservation of urine output may be misleading in hiding the postrenal partial obstruction.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. Postrenal AKI occurs when the normally unidirectional flow of urine is acutely blocked either partially or totally, leading to increased retrograde hydrostatic pressure and interference with glomerular filtration. Option: C. For AKI to occur in individuals with two healthy functional kidneys, the obstruction must affect both kidneys in order to observe large increases in SCr. Option: D. Unilateral obstruction may cause AKI in the setting of significant underlying CKD or, in rare cases, from reflex vasospasm of the contralateral kidney.

questions.text: A 43-year-old man weighing 60 kg is admitted to the ICU with sepsis and is found to have declining urine output. Since the last 12 hrs his urine output is 25 ml/hr. The urine routine shows 1+ proteinuria and a muddy brown cast. Which of the following is true about this condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Blood urea: creatinine ratio < 20 The patient has a urine output of less than 0.5ml/kg/h for >6 hrs suggestive of AKI. Also, urine shows the presence of muddy brown casts +protein suggestive of Acute tubular necrosis which is a form of intrinsic renal failure.

Random:

Explanation For Incorrect Options:- Option: A. urine specific gravity > 1.020 = prerenal azotemia Option: B. URINE OSM > 350 = prerenal azotemia
